# conductorone_vault (Resource)

Vault Resource

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "conductorone_vault" "my_vault" {
  description  = "...my_description..."
  display_name = "...my_display_name..."
  group_authz_vault = {
    # ...
  }
  magic_vault = {
    allow_unauthed_views = false
    allowed_views        = 5
  }
  owner_ids = [
    "..."
  ]
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `display_name` (String) The displayName field.

### Optional

- `description` (String) The description field.
- `group_authz_vault` (Attributes) The GroupAuthzVault message. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--group_authz_vault))
- `magic_vault` (Attributes) The MagicVault message. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--magic_vault))
- `owner_ids` (List of String) The ownerIds field. Requires replacement if changed.

### Read-Only

- `created_at` (String)
- `credential_expiration_duration` (String)
- `id` (String) The id field.
- `updated_at` (String)

### Nested Schema for `magic_vault`

- `allow_unauthed_views` (Boolean) The allowUnauthedViews field.

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

In Terraform v1.5.0 and later, the [`import` block](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/language/import) can be used with the `id` attribute, for example:

```terraform
import {
  to = conductorone_vault.my_conductorone_vault
  id = "..."
}
```

The [`terraform import` command](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cli/commands/import) can be used, for example:

```shell
terraform import conductorone_vault.my_conductorone_vault "..."
```
